intro: Pilosella peleteriana subsp. peleteriana, commonly known as the slenderleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It features small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native environment.
